full_text: eas 2024/KER/2898 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE BECHU KURIAN THOMAS THURSDAY, THE 11'4 DAY OF JANUARY 2024 / 21ST POUSHA, 1945 CRL.MC NO. 259 OF 2024 AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 2936/2014 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS, KASARAGOD PETITIONER/ACCUSED: SOBY GEORGE AGED 55 YEARS S/O. KORAH GEORGE FR ABEL NAGAR , KOTHAMANGALAM, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT, PIN - 686693 BY ADVS. G. HARIHARAN PRAVEEN.H. K.S.SMITHA B.R.SINDU V.R.SANJEEV KUMAR RESPONDENTS/COMPLAINANT & STATE: 1 MR. SHANOJ JOSEPH S/O P.V. JOSEPH, RESIDING AT PARAKATTIL HOUSE, P.O. BALEMOOLE, KASARGODE TALUK, KASARGODE DISTRICT WITHIN THE JURISDICTION OF BADIUDUKKA POLICE STATION., PIN - 671532 2 STATION HOUSE OFFICER BADIUDUKKA POLICE STATION, KASARGODE DISTRICT, PIN - 671551 3 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, PIN - 682031 OTHER PRESENT: SMT. SREEJA V. (PP) THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 11.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Pee CRL.MC NO. 259 OF 2024 PE 2 BECHU KURIAN THOMAS, J. ~ CriLM.C. No. 259 of 2024 Dated this the 11 day of January, 2024 ORDER Petitioners are facing a prosecution in a proceeding under Section 138 of the Negoitable Instruments Act (for short the N.I. Act) as C.C No.2936 of 2014 on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-l, Kasaragod. 2. Due to the failure of the petitioners to appear before the court, a non bailable warrant was issued against them and the case has even be transferred to the Long Pending Register. 3. Sri. G. Hariharan, the learned counsel contended that, though petitioners are ready and willing to appear before the court and participate in the trial, since the case has been transferred to the Long Pending Register, there is every possibility that the petitioners will be remanded on the date of their appearance before considering the application. Therefore, petitioners seek for a direction to consider the application on the same day itself. 4. | have heard Smt. Sreeja V., learned Public Pee CRL.MC NO. 259 OF 2024 PE 3 Prosecutor as well. Considering the nature of the order that | proposed to issue notice to respondent No.1 is dispensed with. 5. Even though, the case against the petitioners have been transferred to the Long Pending Register on 30.11.2019, since the petitioners have expressed their willingness to appear before the court and participate in the proceedings, taking note of the circumstances of the case, | am of the view that, a lenient view can be adopted. Accordingly, if the petitioners appear before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-l, Kasaragod in C.C No.2936 of 2014 (now transferred as LPC 155/2019) and files an application for recall of warrant and for grant of bail, learned Magistrate shall consider the same, and pass appropriate orders on the same day itself. To enable the petitioners to appear before the court as directed above, the warrant issued against the petitioners will be kept in abeyance till 22.01.2024. Sd/- BECHU KURIAN THOMAS JUDGE LU Rea nal ae 2024/KER/2898 CRL.MC NO. 259 OF 2024 4 APPENDIX OF CRL.MC 259/2024 PETITIONER ANNEXURES : ANNEXURE I A TRUE COPY OF THE COMPLAINT FILED BY THE 1ST RESPONDENT AGAINST THE PETITIONER AS CC NO.2936/2014 ON BEFORE THE JFCM COURT - I, KASARAGOD ON 27.12.2013 ANNEXURE II A TRUE COPY OF THE CASE DETAILED RELATING TO CC NO.2936/2014 PENDING BEFORE THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-I KASARAGOD ANNEXURE III A TRUE COPY OF THE DAILY STATUS RELATING TO LPC NO.155/2019 IN CC NO.2936/2014 PENDING BEFORE THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT - I KASARAGODE // True Copy // PA To Judge
